ABOUT US

Agile Investments
In Solid Ground

Since 2010

Leopard Asset Management is focused on finding value in overlooked small and mid-cap companies globally. Combining theme-based investing with rigorous fundamental value investment, the fund aims to generate alpha through both long and short positions while adding activist strategies to drive value crystallization.

MORE DETAILS
Identify Theme

The investment manager employs a theme-based approach, targeting structural inefficiencies and transformation opportunities across regions and sectors within the global small and mid-cap universe.

Drivers of Inefficiencies

Once a theme is identified, a top-down approach is applied to analyze the drivers of current market inefficiencies and to assess the catalysts expected to drive structural change.

Realization Catalyst

The investment manager assesses catalysts by analyzing macro, regulatory, and industry forces that may trigger structural change, then evaluating whether companies are positioned to benefit.

OUR FUNDS

Transforming Real Estate Investment

Leopard Global Equity

A global, theme-based equity strategy targeting transformational opportunities.

Leopard Real Estate

Direct real estate investment leveraging market research and acquisition expertise.

Leopard Asset Management Urges Sun Corporation’s Shareholders to Hold Management Accountable for Their Failure to Achieve Their Own Stated Goals of Increasing Shareholder Value

Leopard Asset Management Ltd. (“LAM”) advises various longstanding minority shareholders in Sun Corporation (stock code: 6736 JP). LAM urges Sun’s shareholders to hold management accountable for their failure to achieve their own stated goals of increasing shareholder value. On June 25, vote against Ryusuke Utsumi, CEO and his management team.

By: Ophir Dortheimer Jul 10, 24

Leopard Asset Management Expresses Concerns Over Sun Corporation's Lack of Action to Enhance Shareholder Value

Leopard Asset Management Ltd. (“LAM”) advises various longstanding minority shareholders in Sun Corporation (stock code: 6736 JP). LAM is compelled to express its deep concerns regarding the company’s ongoing undervaluation and management’s apparent reluctance to take meaningful action to address this issue.

By: Ophir Dortheimer Apr 04, 24
